For instance, I initiated a final year project that I was passionate about, but it seemed that no one else was interested in the subject. 15	I always hear people talking about how the death penalty needs to be enforced more often. I, personally, am undecided on my opinion on the death penalty, but in my mind, the death penalty is used primarily as a societal form of retaliation (much the way that putting someone’s head on a pike was used in the past). If this is true, shouldn’t we as a society want as many people to witness what happens to people when they are sentenced to death? At the very least, it will disseminate information to the public about what execution in the United States is actually like (this may, in turn, change the beliefs that someone holds on the death penalty).

column1: 93	Yahoo! Answers seems to have a political and/or racial bias

column1: 96	Today a cat passed on to a busy road. It stood there and was partially injured
column2: then killed by other cars passing over it.   My sister cried out emotionally watching this poor animal suffer. I however
column3: did not feel anything. Watching a animal die will always be unpleasant
column4: but it is not something one should show emotion for. The animal itself was feral
column5: it had no owners to care for it. We also show no connection to the animal
column6: our relationship is like myself viewing a tree in another field. I am a wage earner
column7: and I have no duty of care to an animal running across the road.   It makes sense to feel nothing for the animal as it is another of the many organisms which die and do not effect our lives in any meaningful way.

column1: 97	Three debates in one day criticizing my views on upholding the seriousness of this website have been going on. Convinceme is the only administrator for this website. What he says goes. If he wants to post rules on what to convinceme is acceptable or not
column2: I will abide by them. However
column3: he hasn't. He has left us as a community to make our own decisions. I have every right to flag any debate which I see as inappropriate or harmful to the community. If convinceme strongly opposed what I am doing
column4: he would have banned me
column5: or at least sent me a PM about it. I dislike the fact that intelligent debates get easily run over by repeats. It is taking away the seriousness of this website which I have come to appreciate
column6: and feel obligated to preserve. I'm sure many of you agree with me
column7: but only stop me because you feel I hold selfish ambitions.
